page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: Heavy traffic,with a continous flow of NCB and Mansfield Standard Sand lorries passes through Rainworth,the meeting place of several roads,the main A617 Mansfield to Newark the secondary B6020 Blidworth to Rainworth & minor road to Southwell converge. Coal was also transported via mineral railways,one serving Rufford colliery & the other Blidworth one.Blidworth & Rainworth railway station (Grid ref. 596578)was built in 1896 and served as part of a local service between Mansfield,Farnsfield & Southwell.The passenger service could not compete with the local bus service so ceased to operate.Passing through Rainworth is the hourly 141 opperated by Trent Motor Traction,part of a cross country service between Nottingham & Clay Cross.East Midland bus company operates buses to Mansfield & Newark.
